definitions.usage_example: We need to check in at the hotel by 3 PM.
definitions.alternative_example: We need to register at the hotel by 3 PM.
definitions.usage_example_es: Necesitamos registrarnos en el hotel antes de las 3 PM.

definitions.usage_example: I'm just calling to check in on you.
definitions.alternative_example: I'm just calling to see how you are.
definitions.usage_example_es: Solo llamo para saber cómo estás.

definitions.usage_example: We have to check out of the room by 11 AM.
definitions.alternative_example: We have to leave and pay for the room by 11 AM.
definitions.usage_example_es: Tenemos que dejar la habitación (hacer check-out) antes de las 11 AM.

definitions.usage_example: Hey, check out that new restaurant!
definitions.alternative_example: Hey, look at that new restaurant!

definitions.meaning: Sacar prestado (ej. un libro de biblioteca)
definitions.usage_example: I need to check out these books from the library.
definitions.alternative_example: I need to borrow these books from the library.
definitions.usage_example_es: Necesito sacar prestados estos libros de la biblioteca.

definitions.meaning: Verificar (que alguien o algo esté bien)
definitions.usage_example: I'm going to check on the baby.
definitions.alternative_example: I'm going to see if the baby is okay.
definitions.usage_example_es: Voy a ver cómo está el bebé.

definitions.usage_example: Can you check over my report before I submit it?
definitions.alternative_example: Can you review my report before I submit it?
definitions.usage_example_es: ¿Puedes revisar mi informe antes de que lo entregue?

definitions.usage_example: I love to check off items on my to-do list.
definitions.alternative_example: I love to mark items as complete on my to-do list.
definitions.usage_example_es: Me encanta marcar tareas (ítems) en mi lista de pendientes.
